segment.source: Drop-down lists, also known as combo boxes, start in a compact state and expand to show a list of selectable items.
segment.target: Drop-down lists, also known as combo boxes, start in a compact state and expand to show a list of selectable items.

segment.source: A drop-down list supports either single selection or multiple selection.
segment.target: A drop-down list supports either single selection or multiple selection.

segment.source: The selected item is always visible, and non-visible items can be brought into view when the user taps the selected item.
segment.target: The selected item is always visible, and non-visible items can be brought into view when the user taps the selected item.

segment.source: A list box should draw the user's attention to the full set of alternatives in an important choice.

segment.source: Selection mode
segment.target: Selection mode

segment.source: Selection mode lets users select and take action on a single item or on multiple items.
segment.target: Selection mode lets users select and take action on a single item or on multiple items.

segment.source: It can be invoked through a context menu, by using CTRL+click or SHIFT+click on an item, or by rolling-over a target on an item in a gallery view.
segment.target: It can be invoked through a context menu, by using CTRL+click or SHIFT+click on an item, or by rolling-over a target on an item in a gallery view.

segment.source: When selection mode is active, check boxes appear next to each list item, and actions can appear at the top or the bottom of the screen.
segment.target: When selection mode is active, check boxes appear next to each list item, and actions can appear at the top or the bottom of the screen.

segment.source: There are three selection modes:
segment.target: There are three selection modes:

segment.source: Single: The user can select only one item at a time.
segment.target: Single: The user can select only one item at a time.

segment.source: Multiple: The user can select multiple items without using a modifier.
segment.target: Multiple: The user can select multiple items without using a modifier.

segment.source: Extended: The user can select multiple items with a modifier, such as holding down the SHIFT key.
segment.target: Extended: The user can select multiple items with a modifier, such as holding down the SHIFT key.

segment.source: Tapping anywhere on an item selects it.
segment.target: Tapping anywhere on an item selects it.

segment.source: Tapping on the command bar action affects all selected items.
segment.target: Tapping on the command bar action affects all selected items.

segment.source: If no item is selected, command bar actions should be inactive, except for "Select All".
segment.target: If no item is selected, command bar actions should be inactive, except for "Select All".

segment.source: Selection mode doesn't have a light dismiss model; tapping outside of the frame in which selection mode is active won't cancel the mode.
segment.target: Selection mode doesn't have a light dismiss model; tapping outside of the frame in which selection mode is active won't cancel the mode.

segment.source: This is to prevent accidental deactivation of the mode.
segment.target: This is to prevent accidental deactivation of the mode.

segment.source: Clicking the back button dismisses the multi-select mode.
segment.target: Clicking the back button dismisses the multi-select mode.

segment.source: Show a visual confirmation when an action is selected.
segment.target: Show a visual confirmation when an action is selected.

segment.source: Consider displaying a confirmation dialog for certain actions, especially destructive actions such as delete.
segment.target: Consider displaying a confirmation dialog for certain actions, especially destructive actions such as delete.

segment.source: Selection mode is confined to the page in which it is active, and can't affect any items outside of that page.
segment.target: Selection mode is confined to the page in which it is active, and can't affect any items outside of that page.

segment.source: The entry point to selection mode should be juxtaposed against the content it affects.
